Key Match Events: France lost 1-3 to Italy in the UEFA Nations League match.
Kylian Mbappe scored in the 1st minute.
Dimarco, Frattesi, and Raspadori scored for Italy.
Retegui scored for France in the 49th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: France has a deep well of talent despite several injuries.
Michael Olise receives his first senior call-up.
Manu Kone could make his debut against Italy.
Benjamin Pavard and Ferland Mendy have been left out due to injuries.
Loic Bade and Matteo Guendouzi were drafted in as cover.
Post-Match Reflections: France's loss to Italy was a setback for their UEFA Nations League campaign.
Kylian Mbappe needs two more goals to reach his half-century.
France's captain returns to win an 85th international cap.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Parc des Princes in Paris.
France possible starting lineup: Maignan; Kounde, Saliba, Konate, T. Hernandez; Kante, Tchouameni, Zaire-Emery; Dembele, Thuram, Mbappe
Others: The UEFA Nations League match between France and Italy was played on September 6, 2024.
